resources.string:
This is a simple widget that shows your bookmarks (from Android's stock browser or Google Chrome) as a scrollable list.

 Only these two browsers are supported. If you use any of them to serf the internet, you might find this widget useful.

 There are two different widgets included. To install the widget, select "Lista Segnalibri widget" 4x2 or 2x2 from the available widgets.
 You will see the configuration screen, where you can select the transparency of the background, the color theme (dark or light), or you can customize the colors. You can see a preview of the widget with the colors you have selected. You can also select whether the bookmarks will be ordered by description or date of access (most recent first).
 If Google Chrome is installed on your device, you can also select which browser's bookmarks you want the widget to show.

 You can have more than one widgets on your home screens, each showing different bookmarks.
 The widget is resizable. The initial size is 4x2 or 2x2 (columns x rows), but you can resize it as you want. To resize, long click on the widget until it gets detached from the screen, then release. You will be able to resize it now.

 If you have changed the bookmarks (add-delete-change), you can refresh each widget by pressing the button with the circular arrows.

 You can also search the bookmarks by clicking the "Ricerca" button. The search is not performed in the widget itself. Instead an activity is launched.

 Notes: 
 -The app needs to be installed in the internal memory of the phone in order for the widget to show up and work.
 -If the widget does not show chrome's bookmarks: open chrome, put it in the background with the home button, and refresh the widget.
 -The app is not yet tested on Android 6, so it might not work correctly.
